sen.j: 翌1236年（嘉禎2年）覚盛（かくじょう）、円晴（えんせい）、有厳（うごん）らと東大寺で自誓受戒し、海龍王寺を経て1237年（嘉禎3年）西大寺に戻り結界し、律宗を復興させた。
sen.e: In the following 1236, he made self-ordination at the Todai-ji Temple with Gakujo, Ensei, and Ugon, and went to the Kairyuo-ji Temple; then in 1237 he returned to the Saidai-ji Temple and made kekkai (to restrict a certain area to prevent priests from prohibiting the precepts) to revive the Ritsu sect.

sen.e: He performed Jukai (handing down the precepts) and Monju Bosatsu kuyo (ceremony of offering to Manjusri); prohibited hunting and fishing in religious acts such as Mantra of Light; offered charity and relief; and restored Uji-bashi Bridge.

sen.e: He accepted anyone's conversion to Buddhism regardless of their social standings, from Hinin (those in the lowest rank of caste system) and lepers to the retired Emperors Gosaga, Kameyama, and Gofukakusa.

sen.j: また、弘安5年（1282年）に四天王寺別当の地位を巡って天台座主（延暦寺）の最源と園城寺長吏の隆弁が自派の候補を出し合って争った際には、朝廷の懇願を受けて両者と利害関係のない叡尊が別当に就任している。
sen.e: In 1282 when Saigen, the head priest of the Tendai sect (Enryaku-ji Temple) disputed with Ryuben, the Chori (chief priest) of Onjo-ji Temple, over the position of the steward of Shitenno-ji Temple by supporting candidates of their own, Eison was appointed to the steward by an entreaty of the Imperial Court because he was not concerted in both parties.

sen.j: 一般には戒律・律宗復興の業績で知られているが、叡尊の本来の意図は権力と結びつきすぎたことから生じた真言宗僧侶の堕落からの再生であった。
sen.e: Eison is generally known for his achievements in the revival of the precepts of Buddhism and the Ritsu sect, but his original intention was to revive priests of the Shingon sect from corruption caused by their overly close connection to the authority.

sen.j: 日本律宗の祖である鑑真が「四分律」を奉じたのに対して、叡尊は真言宗を開いた空海が重んじた「十誦律」を奉じている。
sen.e: While Ganjin (Jianzhen), the founder of the Ritsu sect in Japan, obeyed the Shibunritsu (Four-Part Vinayapitaka, which explains about regulations and prohibited matters of the priests), Eison obeyed the Juju-ritsu (Ten-Reciting Vinayapitaka) that Kukai, the founder of the Shingon sect, valued.

sen.j: また、戒律復興と並行して真言密教の研究を重視しており、弟子の忍性が東国において社会活動や布教に熱を入れすぎて教学が疎かになっているのを窘めたり、元寇の際には西大寺や四天王寺などでモンゴル帝国軍撃退の祈祷や密教儀式を行っている。
sen.e: Eison regarded a revival of precepts and the study of Shingon Esoteric Buddhism as equally important, so he reprimanded his disciple Ninsho for being negligent of the study by being too enthusiastic about social activities and propagation in eastern Japan, and at the time of Mongol invasion attempts against Japan, he offered a prayer and ritual of Esoteric Buddhism at Saidai-ji and Shitenno-ji Temples to repel the Mongol Empire army.
